intro: Bulbostylis communis var. communis, commonly known as the common bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters at the base of the plant. It is often found in moist, sandy soils in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
